titleStmt.title: The most pleasaunt and delectable historie of Lazarillo de Tormes, a Spanyard and of his maruellous fortunes and aduersities. The second part. Translated out of Spanish and into English, by W.P.
Lazarillo de Tormes. Part 2. English.
The most pleasaunt and delectable historie of Lazarillo de Tormes, a Spanyard and of his maruellous fortunes and aduersities. The second part. Translated out of Spanish and into English, by W.P.
Lazarillo de Tormes. Part 2. English.
titleStmt.author: Phiston, William, attributed name.
W. P., fl. 1596.

publicationStmt.publisher: By T[homas] C[reede] for Iohn Oxenbridge, dwelling in Paules Church-yard at the signe of the Parrot,

notesStmt.note: A continuation of "Lazarillo de Tormes" by Diego Hurtado de Mendoza. A different work from the "La segunda parte de La vida de Lazarillo de Tormes" by Juan de Luna.
Running title reads: Lazarillo de Tormes, the Spanyardes life.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
